    • getUserID

      public java.lang.String getUserID()
      Returns the KAPcom user ID (short name).
      Returns:
      UserID.

    • isActualUser

      public boolean isActualUser()
      Returns whether this knowledge is currently linked to an actual user in KAPcom.
      Returns:
      True, if knowledge is currently linked to an actual user in KAPcom.

    • initUserName

      public java.lang.String initUserName​(java.lang.String userPreference)
      This is used to match the user name stored in KAPcom with the driver name entered in the simulator. The driver name in the simulator has precedence. It will be updated in KAPcom, but only if it points to a valid user. If the driver name is NULL, the user name from KAPcom is returned, if it is connected and if there is a user.
      Parameters:
      userPreference - The driver name entered by the user, or NULL.
      Returns:
      The name that should be configured as new driver name.

    • getUserFirstName

      public java.lang.String getUserFirstName()

    • setUserFirstName

      public void setUserFirstName​(java.lang.String value)

      public java.lang.String getUserLastName()

      public java.lang.String getUserDisplayName()

    • getAge

      public int getAge()

    • isFemale

      public boolean isFemale()

    • getAdaptForBadSight

      public boolean getAdaptForBadSight()
      Returns whether the HMI should adapt for "bad sight", e.g. as a result of age or an explicitly stated visual weakness.
      Returns:
      True, if the HMI should adapt for "bad sight"

    • getAdaptSpeakingRate

      public double getAdaptSpeakingRate()
      Returns how the speaking rate should be adapted. This should be considered a scaling factor.
      Returns:
      Value denoting how the speaking rate should be adapted.

    • getAdaptedSpeakingRate

      public int getAdaptedSpeakingRate()
      Returns the adapted speaking rate which can be directly sent to the SVOX TTS.
      Returns:
      Adapted speaking rate.

    • getAdaptAddWarningsSpeech

      public boolean getAdaptAddWarningsSpeech()
      Returns whether TTS speech should be added to all warnings. For demonstration purposes, this is currently enabled manually in the KAPcom.
      Returns:
      True, if TTS speech should be added to all warnings.

    • getAdaptReactionTime

      public double getAdaptReactionTime()
      Returns how small-scale (milliseconds/seconds range) estimates for reaction time should be adjusted to the current user as a result of degraded reactions, e.g. because of age. The returned number can be treated as a scaling factor. It is 1 when no adaptation should be performed.
      Returns:
      Scale of estimates.

    • getAdaptedDisplayTimeMillis

      public long getAdaptedDisplayTimeMillis​(long originalMillis)
      Adapts a display duration for warnings or other messages to the current user. For example, it might increase the time span for older drivers.
      Parameters:
      originalMillis - Time duration to be adjusted (in milliseconds)
      Returns:
      New duration (in milliseconds)

    • getAdaptedDisplayTimeMillis

      public int getAdaptedDisplayTimeMillis​(int originalMillis)

    • getAdaptedTtsVoice

      public java.lang.String getAdaptedTtsVoice()
      Returns the voice to be used for TTS output. This value can be passed directly to the SVOX TTS server.
      Returns:
      The voice to be used for TTS output.
